# How to Use Appdome's Threat Remediation Center

Last updated November 2, 2025 by Appdome

The newly introduced Appdome Threat Remediation Center harnesses the capabilities of GenAI to offer real-time, precise, step-by-step guidance for end users to address threats and attacks on mobile devices swiftly. This innovative solution enhances mobile security by dynamically generating a context-specific ThreatCode™ whenever an Appdome-protected mobile app detects a potential threat. This code encapsulates crucial details about the threat, including the attack vector, device specifics, operating system, and other pertinent data—essentially providing a comprehensive DNA profile of each threat encountered on the mobile device.

Upon receiving a ThreatCode, support, engineering, or cybersecurity professionals from mobile brands and enterprises can input this code into the Threat Remediation Center. Here, Appdome’s advanced Threat Remediation Agent™ employs retrieval augmented generation (RAG) to intelligently formulate responses using GenAI, optimizing the solution for the specific attack scenario. This process not only helps pinpoint and understand the nature of the attack but also guides users through detailed steps to mitigate or completely remove the threat from the affected device.

### Benefits

* **Faster Remediations**: GenAI enables support teams to resolve threats quickly and efficiently by providing detailed, actionable information. This reduces downtime and minimizes the impact of cyber attacks on the end user’s mobile experience.
* **Reduced Support Burden**: Automating the threat remediation process with GenAI alleviates the burden on support centers and cyber teams. This allows these teams to focus on more complex security challenges, improving overall efficiency.
* **User-Threat Specific Remediations**: GenAI’s ability to tailor its recommendations based on the specific device and OS ensures that users receive the most relevant and practical guidance. This personalized approach enhances the overall security of the mobile ecosystem.

### **To Use the Threat Remediation Center Feature:**

1. Log in to your Appdome account.
2. Click on the Threat Remediation Center button on the top menu bar. **![Trc1](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/trc1-1300x303.jpg)**
3. Enter the **Threat Event Code** as it appears in the notification on the user’s mobile device.  
   **Note:** The Threat Event Code may consist of either 8 characters or 14 characters. The 14-character code is only displayed when the mobile app is secured using the latest version of the Appdome engine.
   * **For an 8-Character Code:** Enter the first four characters in the first input field, followed by the remaining four characters in the second field.  
     ![An 8 Digit Threat Event Code Shown On An Android Device That Is Rooted2](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/An-8-digit-threat-event-code-shown-on-an-Android-device-that-is-rooted2-650x128.png)
   * **For a 14-character Code:** Enter the first four characters in the first field, the next four characters in the second field, and, if applicable, the final six characters in the third field.  
     **![A Threat Event Code Displayed On A Mobile Device That Is Jailbroken](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/A-threat-event-code-displayed-on-a-mobile-device-that-is-jailbroken-e1731325249343.png)**
4. Additional details (if required) 
   * If the Threat Code entered does not result in the Appdome platform automatically pre-filling in the device and operating system details:
   * Select the **Mobile Operating System** where the threat event notification appeared. Options include Android or iOS.
   * Enter the **version**. The version refers to the specific release or update number of the OS, such as Android 11 or iOS 14.4.
   * Select the mobile **device manufacturer** (e.g., Apple, Samsung) to which the threat event notification appeared.
   * Select the **Device Model** to ensure the remediation matches the client’s device, such as the Samsung Galaxy S22.
5. Select the **detection date range** for your search: ‘Last Six Months’ (default), ‘Last Year,’ or ‘Last Two Years.’  
   The exact Detection Date associated with the threat will auto-populate only if a valid Threat Code is entered.  
   ![Date Picker For The Threat Resolution Center](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Date-picker-for-the-threat-resolution-center.png)
6. Click the **Get Remediation** button to see the relevant remediation.  
   ![Get Remediation](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Get-Remediation-650x155.jpg)
7. View the Publisher Info about the mobile app, including:
   * **App Name**
   * **App Logo or Icon**
   * **App Bundle ID**
   * **App Version**
   * **Mobile Platform:** Android or iOS
   * [**Appdome Version**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/breakdown-of-appdome-version-number/)
   * **Team Name**
   * [**Fusion Set Name**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/create-mobile-app-protection-templates-for-android-ios-apps-in-devsecops-build-system/)
   * [**Appdome Build ID**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/test-secured-mobile-apps/use-appdome-build-id-to-troubleshoot-secured-mobile-apps/)
   * **Build Date**.
8. View the Mobile Defense Details.
   * **Defense Type:** Mobile Malware Prevention
   * **Defense Name:** Block Custom Frida
   * **Reason:** Protect app IP and prevent data leakage
   * **Triggered On:** Active Custom Frida on Android Device
   * **Threat Event:** No
   * **Policy:** Appdome Defense
   * **Support REF:** 6905-1
   * **Notification:** MyAndroidApp detected the use of Frida or a similar tool. To protect you, the app will close.
   * **Detection Date:** The date when the threat was detected on the mobile device.
9. Read through the Threat Description
   * Provides an overview of the threat and its potential impact on the mobile app.  
     ![Threat Description](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Threat-Description.png)
10. How to Find the Threat

    * Utilize the step-by-step instructions on how to find the threat on the mobile device.  
      ![How To Find The Threat](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/How-to-Find-the-Threat-2.png)
11. How to Disable/Remove the Threat
    * Includes detailed step-by-step instructions on how to remove/uninstall the threat from the mobile device.  
      ![How To Remove The Threat](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/How-to-Remove-the-Threat.png)
12. Download Remediation Details
    * Download your remediation details as a PDF for documentation, compliance, or sharing purposes. This helps streamline reporting and allows you to archive information for future reference.

      ![Threat Remediation Center Branded Support Portal ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Threat-Remediation-Center-Branded-Support-Portal-_-scaled.jpg)

      …

## Managing Recent Remediations

The **Recent Remediations** section provides powerful tools to help you organize and access past threat remediations efficiently:

* **Pin Important Remediations**: You can pin up to three remediations at a time, making it easier to quickly reference commonly needed solutions.
* **View Recent Activity**: Access up to 30 of your most recent remediations. Each entry includes a “Query Made By” field, indicating the team member who initiated the remediation, which improves traceability and team collaboration.
* **Rename Remediations**: Customize the names of your saved remediations for easier identification. This is especially helpful when managing a high volume of threat cases.  
  ![Recent](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/recent-645x366.jpg)
